supporters.name: AVM Computersysteme Vertriebs GmbH
supporters.comment: Wikipedia matters! In our company, we experience the power of knowledge on a daily basis and see how important it is to be aware of available knowledge. Wikipedia is an integral part of digital life and essential for society. Because free access to knowledge is a quantum leap. We support the Wikipedia team that champions quality and diversity every day.

supporters.name: Hendrik Klindworth
supporters.comment: Wikimedia promotes free access to knowledge. Nowadays, this is more important than ever. Which is why I am happy to support this goal.

supporters.name: Lotum GmbH
supporters.comment: Since everybody at Lotum enjoyed the privilege of extensive in-depth education, we also want to give something back and support organizations that facilitate easier access to education. Wikimedia has been revolutionary in this context and deserves our particular support.

supporters.name: Wolfgang-Peter Jüttner
supporters.comment: A new Nuremberg funnel – in 2005, I treated myself to the latest print edition of the Brockhaus encyclopedia in 30 volumes, with a total width of 1.8m, the substantial weight of 60kg and leather spines. Years later, I discovered the weightless online encyclopedia Wikipedia – a totally addictive source of knowledge. Searching for term A leads me to another term B via a link and on to the next term C via another link (this used to be called the "Brockhaus effect", describing what an encylopedia does to its users). At the end of the search, the user is wrapped in a cloud of insights - about a person, a historic event, and so on. Never before has this been as easy, quick and comfortable - it is just like using a Nuremberg funnel. Wikipedia is for flexible curious minds with a thirst for knowledge. Now dust is gathering on the gilt edges of my encyclopediæ, which is only disturbed once or twice a year when I look something up in the bound volumes.

supporters.name: dSPACE GmbH
supporters.comment: I value this source of information, because I perceive it as largely neutral. And due to the large number of authors and editors, the quality of available information is consistently high.

supporters.name: Michael Fernau
supporters.comment: For me, Wikipedia works as a "social encyclopedia", adding to available research opportunities by using the extremely diverse knowledge of the community of authors. In some articles, the pages with discussions and different versions are full of rich material for a critical evaluation of the article topics, and sometimes also for one's own social studies. A democratic, freely accessible knowledge database that will hopefully continue to receive a steady influx of articles, also including contributions by new experts who join the community. Fantastic! Absolutely essential! Deserves all the support it can get!

supporters.name: IGES Institut GmbH
supporters.comment: In my view, Wikipedia is one of the greatest classical education projects worldwide, because it facilitates access to high-quality education without barriers. We are happy to support Wikipedia's mission. Professor Dr. Bertram Häussler

supporters.name: Bernd Hansen
supporters.comment: Only a knowledge-based society can be successful. For that purpose, knowledge has to be accessible to everyone, and Wikipedia makes a major contribution to achieve this.

supporters.name: Solutio GmbH
supporters.comment: Our staff enjoys accessing the compactly and competently collected knowledge in Wikipedia. With our donation, we want to make a contribution to ensure that the encyclopedia can continue to exist in its current format and will continue to be expanded in the future.

supporters.name: Nico Gormsen
supporters.comment: Our family uses Wikipedia almost every day. Time and again, the information this platform offers to humankind amazes us. Wikipedia is a reliable and well-researched source of knowledge – particularly in in this day and age. Thank you so much!

supporters.name: Prof. Dr. Hartmut Gaßner
supporters.comment: Wikipedia is of great help to obtain knowledge about topics from profession, leisure time, hobbies or family and health at lightning speed. I happily support Wikipedia because it is a great institution for many, but also facilitates myself. With my ongoing gifts I want to repeatedly say thank you!

supporters.name: Gross Rechtsanwaltsgesellschaft mbH
supporters.comment: Knowledge and the access to knowledge is the key to our future and for a better society with more opportunities for everyone. Instead of endlessly surfing the WWW for information Wikipedia offers controlled and relevant knowledge – for free and for everyone! Many thanks for that

supporters.name: Prof. Dr. Benno Heussen
supporters.comment: Wikipedia is the most unusual knowledge project of the media age. It is extremely valuable for my work. My annual donation is intended to show the large number of volunteers that their work is valued, and also as support to keep this idea stays alive.

supporters.name: Dorothea und Hartmut Samtleben
supporters.comment: Wissen is Nacht (mission statement of the Eydeetic philophysic according to Prof. Dr. Abdul Nachtigaller)

supporters.name: Jan Hilpert
supporters.comment: Wikimedia is an outstanding example of the value of shared information – as expressed in the quote attributed to George Bernhard Shaw: If you have an apple and I have an apple and we exchange these apples then you and I will still each have one apple. But if you have an idea and I have an idea and we exchange these ideas, then each of us will have two ideas.

supporters.name: Nicolas Woll / Designscape
supporters.comment: What would the world be without access to free knowledge? We want to contribute our part with this donation, so knowledge and education are accessible to everyone and don’t become a privilege or monopoly. Many thanks to the staff and volunteers at Wikimedia Germany for their valuable work.

supporters.name: Agentur MASCARA GmbH
supporters.comment: Not a day goes by when I don't make use of the knowledge collected in Wikipedia. With this donation, I just want to say "Thank you" and make a contribution to continued access to this knowledge free of charge. Soraya Müller, Managing Director

supporters.name: Nationales Institut für Wissenschaftskommunikation, NaWik gGmbH
supporters.comment: NaWik's vision is that science is firmly rooted in society. This involves better information about scientific issues and a competent and knowledgeable public discourse about scientific topics. Freely accessible and neutral knowledge is the prerequisite to achieve this purpose. We want to thank the Wikimedia Deutschland team for their daily commitment to provide and share knowledge. We are very happy to support this valuable work!

supporters.name: HMS Analytical Software GmbH
supporters.comment: As an IT consultancy, "knowledge" takes centre stage for us. This focus ensures that projects are successful, and it attracts highly qualified job applicants. In order to acquire this knowledge, we use a number of different sources of information – and of course Wikipedia ranks high as a reliable and extremely comprehensive knowledge database.

supporters.name: Anton Thimet
supporters.comment: In times of "alternative facts" and esoteric aberrations, my donation is intended to provide a reliable platform for facts that can be measured objectively and for sound scientific findings. Save the Enlightenment!!

supporters.name: Christoph Röllig
supporters.comment: Knowledge is our greatest treasure. Knowledge is the most important foundation of a humane and democratic society. Knowledge is the best antidote against poverty and diseases. Knowledge for everyone makes our world a better place. Knowledge for everyone is simply great! Thank you, Wikipedia

supporters.name: AUVESY GmbH & Co KG
supporters.comment: There are many volunteers behind Wikipedia who help coordinate the large number of articles and entries. In order to ensure that the encyclopedic offer will continue to be available, we, the AUVESY GmbH & Co KG, support Wikipedia with our donation.

supporters.name: Stephan Douteil Elektromaschinenbau
supporters.comment: We support Wikimedia because everybody should get the opportunity to be protected against errors through knowledge.

supporters.name: Cerona GmbH
supporters.comment: We use Wikipedia contents on a daily basis – effectively as a matter of course. With our donation, we want to contribute to continued free access to knowledge.

supporters.name: Otto Braun
supporters.comment: Without freely accessible knowledge, a society loses its self-determination – which is why I support Wikipedia.

supporters.name: Relaxdays GmbH
supporters.comment: Access to knowledge is a special good of our times. This is the reason why we support the largest free knowledge database on behalf of the entire Relaxdays team.

supporters.name: Susanne L.
supporters.comment: A HUUUGE 'Thank you' to the entire Wiki team!

supporters.name: Mietens & Partner GmbH
supporters.comment: For years now, Wikipedia has been one of the main sources of information for the research purposes of our staff. A big 'Thank you' to the Wikipedia team and the myriad of free authors.

supporters.name: VÖLKEL Threading Solutions
supporters.comment: Providing easy access routes to knowledge is among the greatest goods a society can offer.

supporters.name: Nadine und Henning Wolf
supporters.comment: We like supporting Wikimedia because we think that granting free access to knowledge is essential. And almost daily we are using Wikipedia ourselves to expand our knowledge. Thanks.

supporters.name: Energie- & Umweltbüro e.V.
supporters.comment: We as an association working in the IT-sector, appreciating open-source-software, support Wikipedia because they created such an immensely large collection of freely-accessible knowledge. A fat thank you to everyone who contributed to that!

supporters.name: Ingeborg von Schlenk-Barnsdorf Stiftung
supporters.comment: Wikimedia reliably offers free and unrestricted access to knowledge. Based on sound research and always up to date, this knowledge it is always globally available without advertising. We are very happy to support this unique neutrality.

supporters.name: Stefan Kamsties
supporters.comment: For me, freely and easily available, reviewed and robust knowledge is the greatest thing since the Enlightenment. Wikipedia's work most certainly deserves our support. Thank you so much, dear contributors!

supporters.name: HanseEscrow Management GmbH
supporters.comment: Technology Escrow ensures the continuity of business-critical processes. The free transfer of knowledge is a critical factor for society. It has been a pleasure for us to contribute to the continued existence of Wikipedia with our donation.

supporters.name: marmalade GmbH
supporters.comment: Freely accessible knowledge is a privilege. For us as an IT company with a strong focus on open source, we are committed to support and sustain this open principle of collecting and sharing knowledge and information. Thank you for all your dedicated work!

supporters.name: Dirk Woessner
supporters.comment: Thank you, Wikipedia - irreplaceable, inspiring and utterly invaluable

supporters.name: Radiologische Praxis am Feuersee in Stuttgart
HomeCompany GbR
supporters.comment: Many thanks to the Wikipedia organizers and authors! The HomeCompany agencies in Bochum, Dortmund, Essen and Wuppertal.

supporters.name: Hubertus Siegert
supporters.comment: In great hope that the unique system of Wikimedia will keep self-directedly meriting the precise as possible presentation of issues and events in the future.

supporters.name: Schønlein Media GmbH
supporters.comment: With the podcast „Einschlafen mit Wikipedia“ we bring joy to thousands of people each day. So we can keep doing that in the future, we want to say thank you and share our success with Wikimedia.

supporters.name: Familie Frohmann
supporters.comment: for us, wikipedia is an authority on knowledge and truth; and both are values we are happy to support.

supporters.name: Jonas Echterhoff
supporters.comment: When I first discovered Wikipedia in the 2000s I was very impressed to see how well it works to create something great through the collaboration of volunteers. Through the free access to knowledge all of mankind is supported to educate and thereby emancipate themselves. That I want to support!

supporters.name: Avinway Consultants S. Asendorf
supporters.comment: To make high-quality knowledge accessible to everyone is a big step towards equal opportunities for all humankind. A lot of commitment from those who are actively involved is necessary to continuously develop this project further, and I have the greatest respect for these people.

supporters.name: Andreas und Sabine von Tiedemann und Freunde
supporters.comment: Knowledge is the foundation of truth. And truth is the only foundation we can build on in the long term. Wikipedia serves this purpose in a way that is accessible to everyone, which deserves unconditional support.

supporters.name: Robert Nönnig
supporters.comment: Many thanks to everyone for making the Wikimedia projects possible!

supporters.name: antaŭi GmbH | Chris Schaulandt
supporters.comment: Collective, global and free knowledge is the key or at least a significant contribution to solving global problems. Because a well-informed public can be guided by facts in order to shape the future with science and expert knowledge. Wikipedia goes far beyond simply looking up information. (Hopefully) it shapes a better future for all of us.

supporters.name: Aegidius Schuster
supporters.comment: Everything for free - all for nothing - is yesterday's news.

supporters.name: Reinmuth Galvanik GmbH
supporters.comment: The world is becoming increasingly more complex. In our everyday lives, Wikipedia provides quick access to background knowledge to help with current issues. Both for our professional and our private lives, this is an invaluable asset.

supporters.name: top concepts GmbH
supporters.comment: Knowledge matters! The Wikipedia team pools knowledge and makes it available to us and to the entire world. That's really great!

supporters.name: AGORA direct Ltd.
supporters.comment: Goethe says: "What we know is a drop; what we don't know is an ocean." In order to also make our own ocean smaller every day, we need support provided by Wikipedia. We believe that knowledge is the basis for freedom and tolerance.

supporters.name: Prof. Rethmeier
supporters.comment: Since WIKIPEDIA came into being, accessing knowledge has been straightforward for everyone. Because of The transparent discussion of contents, the level of specialist knowledge is quasi-scientific!

supporters.name: Cabalon, Inhaber Mitch Köhler
supporters.comment: Knowledge is one of the strongest drivers of progress. We as IT experts want to show our support and appreciation for Wikipedia's committed work. A big 'Thank you' to everyone who makes Wikipedia possible every day, worldwide, for free and in a wide range of languages!

supporters.name: Prof. em. Dr. Rudi Schmidt
supporters.comment: The worldwide disposable encyclopaedia 'Wikipedia' is a terrific project even though it will remain forever unfinished. Their universal orientation, economic and political independence and social neutrality are essential to be preserved from attempts of engulfment.

supporters.name: Jan Rollmann
supporters.comment: Free knowledge is not to be taken for granted. A service that has been providing free knowledge for centuries and is not financed by advertisement or monthly subscriptions however is a curiosity. Many thanks to Wikipedia!

supporters.name: Dres. Ines und Ralf Warmuth
supporters.comment: Free knowledge for everyone

supporters.name: audius GmbH
supporters.comment: We at audius want to foster the project “simplify access to education” through our donation. Wikipedia as a permanent part of an increasingly digital society has an important task which we would like to support.

supporters.name: Jürgen Grether
supporters.comment: Knowledge is the strongest weapon for freedom. Wikipedia as an independent platform conveys knowledge in many languages and brings the freedom for many people on this planet into close proximity. As long as this remains and Wikipedia prohibits manipulation by personal interests, politics, economy/industry and lobbying, I will support Wikimedia.
